Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored 95, coming agonisingly close to Sachin Tendulkar's record of most hundreds in 50-over format.
Mohammed Shami took five wickets in an innings for the second time in the ODI World Cup, setting a record for an Indian bowler.
Ravindra Jadeja remained unbeaten on 39 off 44 balls, contributing to the team's victory.
Post-Match Reflections: India's win propelled them to the top of the standings with 10 points, two more than New Zealand, who suffered their first defeat in the tournament.
Virat Kohli expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Devon Conway was out for a duck when he was holed out at square leg by Shreyas Iyer in the fourth over.
Will Young was dismissed by Mohammed Shami in the ninth over.
Rachin Ravindra and Daryl Mitchell put on a massive 159-run partnership for the third wicket to set a good platform for a big total.
Mitchell scored his career-best 130, off 127 balls, which included five sixes and nine fours.
KL Rahul was dismissed by Trent Boult in the 22nd over, and Suryakumar Yadav was run out in the next over.
Rohit Sharma became the first Indian to hit 50-plus ODI sixes in a calendar year.
Others: The match was played in Dharamsala and was affected by fog.
India won the toss and decided to bowl first.
